comment.text: Required for insulin-stimulated glucose transport and glucose transporter SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation from intracellular glucose storage vesicle (GSV) to the plasma membrane (PM) in adipocytes. Binds phospholipid membranes in a calcium-dependent manner and is necessary for the optimal membrane fusion between SLC2A4/GLUT4 GSV and the PM.
Binds 3 Ca(2+) ions per C2 domain.
Dynamically associated with GLUT4-containing glucose storage vesicles (GSV) and plasma membrane in response to insulin stimulation.
The C2 domain binds to calcium and membrane lipids.
Phosphorylated on Ser-197 by active myristoylated kinase AKT2; insulin-stimulated phosphorylation by AKT2 regulates SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation into the plasma membrane.

property.value: Translocation of SLC2A4 (GLUT4) to the plasma membrane
Expressed in secondary oocyte and 244 other tissues
P:insulin receptor signaling pathway via phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase
P:positive regulation of glucose transmembrane transport
P:positive regulation of protein targeting to membrane

feature.description: Reduces calcium-binding, phospholipid membrane-binding and insulin-stimulated SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation; when associated with A-26; A-76; A-78 and A-84.
Reduces calcium-binding, phospholipid membrane-binding and insulin-stimulated SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation; when associated with A-19; A-76; A-78 and A-84.
Reduces calcium-binding, phospholipid membrane-binding and insulin-stimulated SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation; when associated with A-19; A-26; A-78 and A-84.
Reduces calcium-binding, phospholipid membrane-binding and insulin-stimulated SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation; when associated with A-19; A-26; A-76 and A-84.
Reduces calcium-binding, phospholipid membrane-binding and insulin-stimulated SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation; when associated with A-19; A-26; A-76 and A-78.
Inhibits insulin-stimulated AKT2-induced phosphorylation, SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation to the cell surface and GSV-PM fusion.
Does not inhibit insulin-stimulated SLC2A4/GLUT4 translocation.
